item.title: Litter on Both sides of Tabard Street, 4th August
item.description:
There are plastic bottles, food packaging, broken glass on the pavement and road on bothsides of Tabard Street. This has been there for over five days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217, Tabard Street, The Borough, London

item.title: Clothes dumped in front Recycling bin on Great Dover street, 4th August
item.description:
There are clothes dumped infront of the Scope Clothes recycling bin which has been there over seven days. The location is on Great Dover Street. This has been reported many times but the items still remained on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Dover Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerbside debris has been scraped out, 4th August
item.description:
It appears someone from the council have scraped out debris (mainly soil) from kerbside outside houses 32 to 40 but have left it all in a mess & not swept it up, or advised why this was carried out. The residents were hoping the edges would be replaced as they were put down some time ago & did not withstand any length of time, just broke up, crumbled & collected dirt & weeds growing. The road cleaning service does not manage to clean this side of the road due to vehicles always parked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Onslow Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins blocking pavement, 4th August
item.description:
Bins from 47 A,B,C Dalyell rd blocking pavement. The bins have been like this for days and are regularly left blocking access for pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Combermere Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside the church on Wildfell Road food that no one is taking, 4th August
item.description:
This food was left outside the church early yesterday although I get the nice gesture nobody is taking it and we are over run by rats nearly all of Wildfell Road and hamlet close have now have rats in our garden and openly running around out the front I fear this is going to be left there now to rot

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Wildfell Road, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of litter left on street, 4th August
item.description:
From Friday evening, all weekend until Monday morning, there was garbage and fly tipping left on the corner of Hearn Street as shown in the photographs. This is not the first time and is unacceptable given the council tax we pay to keep our streets clean.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hearn Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree fallen outside Strongbow Crescent, 4th August
item.description:
A large tree branch has fallen outside Strongbow Crescent tower block (SE9 1DR) This is now obstructing the pathway, and it narrowly missed park cars. This branch has come from a very old tree, and will need further inspection to see if it is at risk of falling further as kids play in the communal green and there are several parked cars in this area. W3W ///sheep.treat.nuns

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strongbow Crescent, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
